thread.title: Thai Airways to end Los Angeles service
thread.title_full: Thai Airways to end Los Angeles service

author: Buying Business Travel
title: Thai Airways to end Los Angeles service
text:
Thai Airways to end Los Angeles service 0 comments Follow @BBT_online 
Thai Airways is axing its Bangkok to Los Angeles service from October, the airlineâ€™s only US route. 
Last winter, the carrier operated a B77-300ER on the Bangkok-Seoul Incheon-LAX route on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays as flights TG692/693. This summer season a four-times weekly B777-200ER service plies the route. 
But from October 25, Thai Airways will no longer fly to LA. 
On the same date, the airline is also cancelling its Bangkok-Rome service, reports airlineroute.net . 
B747-400 flights TG944/945 currently operate four-times weekly on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. 
The cutbacks follow Thai Airways' decision to halve flight frequency to both London Heathrow and Frankfurt this summer.
